intro: Echeveria angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features rosettes of fleshy, narrow, blue-green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder, known as farina. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or orange during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements, it is well-suited for arid climates.
